properties.areaDesc: Wabash, IL; Daviess, IN; Knox, IN; Gibson, IN; Pike, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 5 at 11:35AM EST until January 8 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...A Flood Warning continues for portions of the following waterways
in Indiana...

East Fork White River...White River...

.Minor lowland flooding will continue in a few locations along the
lower White River and at one location along the East Fork White
River.

A strong storm system may bring heavy rainfall back to the area by next weekend.
This could renew flooding early next week. Monitor forecasts thru this week.

The Flood Warning continues for
The White River at Petersburg.
* until Wednesday morning.
* At 10:30 AM Sunday the stage was 18.0 feet.
* Flood stage is 16.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...It will rise to near 18.1 feet by this afternoon then
begin falling. It will fall below flood stage Tuesday evening.
* At 18.0 feet...Lowland flooding begins to flood several Pike County
roads.  Many of the following county roads begin to flood around
this level...east of SR 57 include CR 750N...CR 600N and CR 1000E.
Pike county road subject to flooding west of SR 57 include...CR 250
W...CR 400W...CR 675N...CR 700 N...CR  1000w...CR 900W...CR 700W
and CR 775W.
properties.instruction:
Precautionary/Preparedness Actions...

Motorists should never drive into flood water. Turn around and go
another way. Keep children away from flooded areas. Recreational and
agricultural interests should remain alert to changing river
conditions.

For detailed flood information go to weather.gov/ind on the web and
click on rivers and lakes.
